paragraphs.text: The State ofAcute Malnutrition

Organisations around the world are coming together to systematically document, analyse and synthesise information related to programme innovations and adaptations in the management of child wasting during COVID19. This page serves to track protocol adaptations across contexts, highlight innovative case studies, and aggregate available resources as part of a study by Action Against Hunger, USAID, UNICEF, and the US Centers for Disease Control.
View Case Studies
WHO/UNICEF Implementation Guidance
Concern's Adapting CMAM in the Context of COVID-19
GOAL’s Use of Family MUAC in the Context of COVID-19
Standard Operating Procedure: MUAC Screening in the Context of COVID-19

EN-NETis a free and open resource to help field practitioners have access to prompt technical advice for operational challenges for which answers are not readily accessible. Available resources include a range of discussion threads on COVID-19 and nutrition programming, as well as simplified approaches for the management of acute malnutrition.

TheGlobal Nutrition Clusteraims to improve the effectiveness of nutrition programs in humanitarian response by ensuring greater predictability, accountability, and partnership. Available resources include the UNICEF/GNC joint statement on COVID and wasting, guidance on coordination, nutrition information management, and surveillance in the context of COVID-19, and an online data portal. The GNC has also compiled a list of COVID-19 learning resources from the World Health Organization and other partners, including the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, Save the Children, and Bioforce.

TheGlobal Technical Assistance Mechanism for Nutrition(GTAM) is a one-stop platform supported by the GNC and its partners to provide support and technical guidance for nutrition in emergencies. Available resources include collections of tools and guidance related to prevention and management of wasting, nutrition for infants and young children, and nutrition information systems.
Join the Family MUAC CoP
Visit the Family MUAC Community of Practice for resources, case studies, and frequently asked questions.
Join the Simplified Approaches CoP
Visit the Community of Practice on Simplified Approaches to Acute Malnutrition Treatment for curated key resources and links to further information.
Join the Coverage CoP
Visit the Coverage Community of Practice for resources, case studies, and frequently asked questions.

Between 2015 and 2020, The State of Acute Malnutrition was supported by theNo Wasted LivesCoalition, an interagency effort between Action Against Hunger, the Children’s Investment Fund Foundation, the European Commission Directorate-General for Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection (ECHO), the innocent foundation, the International Rescue Committee (IRC), UNICEF, and World Food Programme (WFP). The CMAM 2.0: Reinventing Community Management of Acute Malnutrition grant supported by the Children’s Investment Fund Foundation that financed the No Wasted Lives initiative, is now closed.
Twitter:@AcuteMalnut
Email:info@acutemalnutrition.org
Privacy policy
